snippet: The Rev. Frans van der Lugt, who had provided refuge to Muslim and Christian families alike in the war-ravaged Old City, was reportedly killed by a lone gunman.
abstract: Rev Frans van der Lugt, Dutch Jesuit priest who became a symbol of suffering and compassion in the war-ravaged Old City district of Homs, Syria, is shot to death by a lone gunman; killing comes amid growing disputes between Syrian insurgents blockaded in the Old City.

byline.contributor: Mohammad Ghannam and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Rev. Frans van der Lugt, who had provided refuge to Muslim and Christian families alike in the war-ravaged Old City, was reportedly killed by a lone gunman.

headline.main: Long a Survivor in Syria, a Dutch Priest Is Slain
headline.print_headline: Long a Survivor in Syria, a Dutch Priest Is Slain

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
